reviewText: These discs are Blu-ray in name only. The video quality did not get upgraded and is about the same as a DVD. Audio quality is even worse. It's still Mono. Really??? in this day and age. The only saving grace is, it's 10 bucks for 3 movies.These are really old Jet Li's movies and his acting skills back then weren't quite polished yet. The audio in Tai Chi Master is 5.1, but the special effects in the fight scenes are horrible.  You can clearly see safety ropes tied to the actors whenever they fly in the air during fight scenes. This is sooooo inexcusable, even back in the early 90's when these movies were made. Overall, the movies themselves are pretty entertaining. Just don't pay full price for this item though.

reviewText: Jet Li and Bruce Lee are almost interchangeable terms within my home.  Of course, there is only one Bruce Lee but Jet Li is making a great argument to supersede his GREATNESS on the movie screen.  The action sequences are INCREDIBLE!  These are three of his movies.  If you have not seen The One, Cradle to the Grave, Romeo Must Die or Red Dragon (just to name a few) you may want to add them to your collection too.Thank youDavid

summary: Value for money and such good movies.

reviewText: If you're in love of chinese kung-fu, then this package deal is worth the money. you'll get 3 set of classic martial art in a row. I'm not so referring to his acting but his martial art expertise. I'm not comparing him to Jackie Chan or Brue Lee or Chuck Noris but he indeed has his own set of character that really bring out the cream of Shaolin martial art. The picture quality is not top notch as per HD spec but still worth to give it a shot and put this blu-ray into your library.

reviewText: I love watching Jet Li. Good martial art movies and I'm a big fan of Jet Li also. He's more like a Bruce Lee fellow and actors enjoy working with these chinese martial art actors. I look forward to getting that movie on Blueray too when the price is right... Thanks guys...
